column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Prepare a Strategic Plan for a School
#Text=Developing a strategic plan for a school begins with the alignment of the district strategic plan .
#Text=For example , one of the goals in the district strategic plan may be to improve student attendance .
#Text=Taking that goal for the school may be to improve school attendance by 2 percent over 2 years .
#Text=Usually , strategic plans are for a five year period , so the goals can reflect that as well .
#Text=Each goal that is selected for the school 's strategic plan must align with the district 's strategic plan .

#Text=The school may have fewer goals ( usually no more than three can be reached in one year ) , and each goal should have activities to support the goal as well as a budget to support the activities .
#Text=Each goal must be developed in a " shared experience " with all stakeholders ( teachers , parents , students if high school , and staff ) .

column1: #Text=Listed in a step by step method is the process one would use to develop one of the goals in the strategic plan .

#Text=After each goal activity is completed , then the information is compiled into a comprehensive strategic plan for the school year which includes a spending plan that is aligned to the school 's total budget .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Determine current percent of attendance .
#Text=Most elementary schools are around 95 % attendance with middle schools around 92 % , and high schools around 90 % .
#Text=Each school is provided a report of attendance reporting on a monthly basis by the District Office .
#Text=Discuss with stakeholders the current attendance rate and the need for improvement .
#Text=Discuss a 1 % increase per year for the next two years , which is aligned to the District goal .
#Text=Provide stakeholders with historic attendance reporting and indicate which months are " problematic " .
#Text=Provide stakeholders with number of students needed to make a 1 % increase .
#Text=Develop with stakeholders activities to meet the attendance goal of improvement by 1 % .

#Text=Examples of possible activities include monthly award assemblies for perfect attendance ( usually elementary school students ) , privilege certificates ( such as no homework for a day ) for middle and high school students , attendance clerk to monitor student attendance , and make friendly home phone calls daily for absent students , Vice Principal or other administrator may make home visits for students who have missed 3 days or more before December to determine if any interventions may be appropriate , and end-of-year trips may be tied to attendance .
#Text=These are just a few activities that schools use .
#Text=Be sure to discuss them thoroughly with all stakeholders .
#Text=Determine the cost of each activity and add this into the school 's budget .
#Text=Additional personnel costs may need to be approved by the district budgeting department .
#Text=Share the final comprehensive goal with all stakeholders in a variety of venues .
#Text=For parents and community , include the goal on the school 's website and show the results as well as activities .
#Text=If there is a monthly newsletter , share the goal and activities in the newsletter .
#Text=Send positive notes to students who have improved upon their attendance , and make personal telephone calls to families , thanking them for their child 's improved attendance .

#Text=During back-to-school night activities , be sure to have teaching staff discuss the importance of good attendance to student learning , and provide handouts to parents discussing the goal , the activities to reach the goal , the budget , and scientific research supporting good school attendance .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Always include all stakeholders in the process of developing the strategic plan .
#Text=Keep the planning process to a manageable level .
#Text=Stakeholders will be unable to attend many of the meetings .
#Text=Administrators must do their homework .
#Text=Be sure to get all the data together before beginning the process .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Remember that there will always be folks against the process .
#Text=Keep a positive attitude .
#Text=Go back to the research on attendance and its importance in learning .
#Text=Educate your teachers in the planning process .
#Text=They will be your most positive supporters if they are engaged from the very beginning .
